# Government Tender Notice

## Project Name

Combatant Training and Integration Centre – Atlantic (CTIC(A))

## Reference Number

MX-22598494913

## Publication Date and Tender Closing Date

The publication date for this tender notice is October 20, 2022. The tender closing date is November 29, 2022 at 13:00:00.

## Expected Contract Dates

The expected contract start date is February 28, 2023, while the expected contract end date is the same, February 28, 2023.

## Tender Status and Method

The tender status is expired. The tender method is a competitive open bidding process. It is a requirement for the project.

## Description of the Project

This tender is for a Combatant Training and Integration Centre (CTIC) project. The Royal Canadian Navy (RCN) is in the process of reviving its fleet. The new backbone of the fleet will be the Canadian Surface Combatant (CSC). The future fleet requires a sustainable, scalable, and flexible training and operational support infrastructure to deliver support to the balanced CSC capacity and capabilities. The centre will comprise of a Secure Training Facility, a Maritime Warfare Centre, an Engineering Development Lab, and a Data Warfare Centre.

## Services Included

The services associated with the project include:

- Definition of the project through pre-design and design phases
- Production of construction drawings and specifications
- Construction and commissioning of the centre
- Provision of subcontracts associated with the construction of the centre

## Value of the Contract

The rough order of magnitude (ROM) value of the contract is estimated between $120,000,000 and $140,000,000.

## Security Requirements

The contractor will be required to hold a valid and active FACILITY SECURITY CLEARANCE (FSC) at the level of SECRET granted or approved by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC).

## Sponsorship and Security Clearance Process

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) provides contractors early access to the security clearance application process through sponsorship under its Industrial Security Program (ISP). Contractors interested in submitting a proposal must begin the security clearance sponsorship process by applying to DCC's ISP.

## Languages Used

Both English and French will be used in the tender process.

## Notice URL

The notice URL can be accessed on Merx.com.
